Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a healthy plant that has been watered.
The student can illustrate a wilted or unhealthy plant that has not been watered.
The student can show how other parts of nature, like sunlight, affect plants by including the presence of light in their drawing.
The student can illustrate that plants need water by contrasting plants with water and those without.
The student can observe and use patterns in their drawings to show the effects of water on plant growth.
The student can include details that represent how plants change over time if they do not receive water.
